On route home from the Kwibuka21 commemoration day in London. Note to self...7hrs on a train is not 'commutable'.
The panel discussions have now come to an end. The formal commemoration service will now commence. #Kwibuka21
Survivor Eric Murangwa now speaking, highlighting the importance of survivors in the struggle to keep the memory alive & act against denial
A long term strategy needed; documentation, preserving memory, rigerous research & education. All needs greater investment. @DrJMSmith
On 1 hand we need to protest against denial but on the other, by doing so we are potentially bringing their voice to the table  @DrJMSmith
.@DrJMSmith reflecting on @melverncom contribution to academic documentation of the genocide as well as the bbc campaign, preventing denial
'We should speak up and fight. Denial is not only offensive but also dangerous'. @OliviaRMW  #Kwibuka21
Panelist discussion now with @OliviaRMW  @DrJMSmith and Eric Murangwa on why we must speak out against genocide denial. #Kwibuka21
A call for everyone to bombard the BBC with renewed upset at their refusal to right their wrong in broadcasting a genocide denial doc.
Much of the discussion now focused on the bbc documentary and the damage it has done and the horror at its refusal to appologise #Kwibuka21
Final discussion now led by @RwandaHCUK floor opened for audience to ask panelists. #Kwibuka21
A presentation now by Liliane Umubyeyi about the impact of denial on survivors.
Despite formal complaints, BBC has declaired the programme justified and was produced in the "spirit of journalistic enquiry" @melverncom
"Denial is used to destroy truth & memory, to minimise the scale & status of the crime & to justify whats been done" @melverncom #Kwibuka21
Linda Melvern talking about drivers of genocide denial and the impact of the BBC doc in this. #Kwibuka21
Audience comment;  the need to hand over perpetrators of the genocide for trial. @StephenTwigg agreeing there is a need to work on this.
HE Williams 'issue of historical revisions' Once something has been established as genocide-any alteration of this fact is denial #Kwibuka21
Comment from audience-issue of definition-people attemp to push the '94 genocide into 'civil war' inc BBC doc-hugely dangerous.  #Kwibuka21
Q from the audience-asking whether journalists are trained about Rwanda following BBC doc. HE Williams Nkurunziza says we need to do more.
'Genocide denial is the final stage of genocide.'  Says @StephenTwigg quoting Stanton.#Kwibuka21
The panel now discussing the issues of genocide denial; Linda Melvern, Stephen Twigg & Lilaine Umbyeyi #Kwibuka21 London.
In London today marking 21 years since the genocide in Rwanda #Kwibuka21
